person.note: Shadd was the first Black female newspaper publisher in Canada. She founded and edited The Provincial Freeman and established a racially integrated school for Black refugees in Windsor, Canada West. In 1994, she was designated a Person of National Historic Significance in Canada Yarhi, Eli, and Clayton Ma. “Mary Ann Shadd.” The Canadian Encyclopedia, 2020, https://www.thecanadianencyclopedia.ca/en/article/mary-ann-shadd.

This is a project-specific note about the person.
XTriples test project
